entry.title: Revert "When testing MPC hits for matching inherited data, compare by-value."
entry.content:
This reverts commit c9c6c875f6b8df9aeba5653c60571143e475ba08.



Reason for revert: Suspected culprit for Builder: Linux CFI (more details in bug https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1515486



Original change's description:

> When testing MPC hits for matching inherited data, compare by-value.

>

> This makes for a more expensive comparison, but we get it back by

> getting complete MPC hits more often -- saving both RAM and CPU.

> (The effect is especially pronounced on style recalcs, where the

> MPC already most likely contains nearly everything we'd want.)

> In particular, if two elements get the same state from different

> parts in the tree, the pointers are not the same, but the data

> is equivalent. E.g.

>

> * div

> * div class="a"

> * span class="b"

> * div class="a"

> * span class="b" <-- would get a partial MPC hit before, full now

>

> Note also that there is a knock-on effect from reusing the ComputedStyle

> from the MPC hit, in that any similar children of the two spans would

> now automatically have the same group pointers for inherited data,

> too (so when we get a match, we don't need the by-value comparison for

> all the children; the pointers will be the same and the comparison will

> short-circuit).

>

> This saves a large amount of ComputedStyle RAM:

>

> Video 766 → 395 kB ( -371 kB)

> Extension 3002 → 1670 kB (-1332 kB)

> News 1724 → 1442 kB ( -282 kB)

> ECommerce 238 → 198 kB ( -40 kB)

> Social1 755 → 588 kB ( -167 kB)

> Social2 536 → 461 kB ( -75 kB)

> Encyclopedia 1658 → 1293 kB ( -365 kB)

> Sports 541 → 409 kB ( -132 kB)

> Search 415 → 238 kB ( -177 kB)

>

> It would be possible to force-rewrite equivalent pointers into

> each other to save yet more RAM (one of them could be GC-ed away

> even if we did not have an MPC match), but from a quick prototyping,

> the effect is mostly small, and it costs a little more CPU (~1%).

>

> It also saves CPU (style perftest, Zen 2, LTO but no PGO):

>

> Initial style (µs) Before After Perf 95% CI (BCa)

> =================== ========= ========= ======= =================

> ECommerce 8456 8373 +1.0% [ +0.4%, +1.5%]

> Encyclopedia 71749 70657 +1.5% [ +1.0%, +2.4%]

> Extension 93541 86623 +8.0% [ +7.2%, +8.6%]

> News 36167 35159 +2.9% [ +2.4%, +3.7%]

> Search 10621 10295 +3.2% [ +2.7%, +3.7%]

> Social1 20412 19897 +2.6% [ +2.1%, +3.1%]

> Social2 13418 13165 +1.9% [ +1.3%, +2.6%]

> Sports 39573 38658 +2.4% [ +1.3%, +6.3%]

> Video 30046 27558 +9.0% [ +8.5%, +9.6%]

> Geometric mean +3.6% [ +3.0%, +4.1%]

>

> Recalc style (µs) Before After Perf 95% CI (BCa)

> =================== ========= ========= ======= =================

> ECommerce 5267 4418 +19.2% [+18.1%, +20.5%]

> Encyclopedia 59969 56885 +5.4% [ +5.0%, +6.3%]

> Extension 79453 70043 +13.4% [+12.2%, +14.5%]

> News 27126 22136 +22.5% [+21.5%, +23.6%]

> Search 5500 4340 +26.7% [+25.4%, +27.8%]

> Social1 12423 10405 +19.4% [+18.1%, +20.4%]

> Social2 9104 8050 +13.1% [+11.8%, +14.1%]

> Sports 22436 19062 +17.7% [+15.0%, +26.9%]

> Video 17912 12632 +41.8% [+40.8%, +42.8%]

> Geometric mean +19.6% [+18.5%, +20.8%]

>

> Speedometer3, M1 Pinpoint (lower is better except Score,

> significant results at 95% CI only, ordered by increasing goodness):

>

> TodoMVC-JavaScript-ES6-Webpack [ +0.6%, +2.2%]

> TodoMVC-React-Redux [ +0.2%, +0.9%]

> Editor-TipTap [ +0.2%, +0.6%]

> Charts-chartjs [ -0.9%, -0.1%]

> TodoMVC-Backbone [ -0.8%, -0.1%]

> TodoMVC-JavaScript-ES5 [ -0.8%, -0.1%]

> TodoMVC-jQuery [ -0.8%, -0.2%]

> TodoMVC-React [ -1.1%, -0.3%]

> TodoMVC-Angular [ -1.5%, -0.3%]

> TodoMVC-Preact [ -3.0%, -1.4%]

> TodoMVC-React-Complex-DOM [ -3.7%, -2.6%]

> TodoMVC-WebComponents [ -5.5%, -4.8%]

> TodoMVC-Lit [ -6.6%, -5.7%]

>

> Score [ +0.7%, +1.0%]

>

> We put it behind the CSSMPCImprovement flag (default on), to be able

> to fold it into the ongoing GWS experiment.

>

entry.title: Ignore disconnect signals when a QUIC connection migration is happening on the default network
entry.content:
Suppose that both wifi and mobile networks are active and the default

network is wifi. When wifi becomes unavailable, there could be two

signals from NetworkChangeNotifier via NetworkObserver to trigger

a QUIC connection migration:

- OnNetworkDisconnected() to signal wifi becomes inactive

- OnNetworkMadeDefault() to signal mobile becomes the default network



The former doesn't require proving, but the latter requires proving.



The order of these signals is not guaranteed. Before this CL,

QuicChromiumClientSession didn't handle the case where

OnNetworkMadeDefault() comes first and the OnNetworkDisconnected()

comes next. There was no valid connection IDs until proving finished,

but QuicChromiumClientSession::OnNetworkDisconnectedV2() tried to

migrate immediately, resulting in a migration failure.



To avoid the problem, ignore disconnect signals when a migration is

happening on the default network.



The existing QuicConnectionMigrationTest.Basic test will cover this

change once it starts running on bots.



Bug: 1509458

Change-Id: I9b348ad82ef004800356f5b63c1f702c1d09ccca

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5138419

Commit-Queue: Kenichi Ishibashi

Reviewed-by: Stefano Duo

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1242768}

entry.title: tote tour: Create pref to capture user eligibility
entry.content:
Adds a pref to track whether a user is new for the sake of the holding

space wallpaper nudge. This is necessary because "new" users should be

shown the nudge, but they may not take the triggering action on their

very first session. Capturing that newness and storing it will allow the

nudge to be displayed as appropriate.

entry.title: Manual raw_ptr rewrite: //components/omnibox/.../autocomplete_match.h
entry.content:
The main change in the CL is in

//components/omnibox/browser/autocomplete_match.h where the type of the

`AutocompleteMatch::provider` field is changed from a native pointer

(`AutocompleteProvider*`) into `raw_ptr`. This

follows the guidance from //base/memory/raw_ptr.md to use `raw_ptr`

for all class and struct fields (wherever possible).



Other changes in this CL support the main change outlined above:



* For equality comparison a native pointer needs to be extracted using

an explicit `.get()`

* Various tweaks need to be made to avoid (short-lived) dangling

pointers (detected thanks to the Dangling Pointer Detector that is

enabled by default for all `raw_ptr`).



Bug: 1446392

Change-Id: I9e4a59816089778511e020e2eff724ca954eeadd

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5153332

entry.title: Launch the pending request after OnApps.
entry.content:
This CL is used to prepare for CL:5138416, to fix the browser

tests: WebKioskTest.AlreadyInstalledOffline.



The current code implement the launching saved in the pending list

after registerring the publisher. Well, OnApps are implemented after

registerring the publisher, and it could be async, e.g. Chrome apps

publisher, web apps publisher. So if the launch request is sent to the

publisher too early, when the app platform is not ready yet, the launch

process could fail.



Modify the code to implement the pending launch request after OnApps,

so that we can know which apps have been removed, and implement the

launching request for valid apps only after the app platform is ready.



BUG=1385932, b:307623506



Change-Id: Ib55a524f5abd1b26a9060e229a35bf4c329d6ef1

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5166867

Reviewed-by: Maggie Cai

entry.title: [Code Health] Remove some uses of base::SupportsWeakPtr. (pm)
entry.content:
This CL removes base::SupportsWeakPtr as a base class of by doing

the following:



1. Any abstract base classes that derived from SupportsWeakPtr

now have a pure virtual member function that returns a WeakPtr

to the base class.



2. Any class that derives from one of the abstract base class has

a new base::WeakPtrFactory data member and overrides the function

to return a WeakPtr from the factory. For added safety, these

classes are marked final when possible.



3. Any implementation class that uses SupportsWeakPtr now has a

member function that returns a WeakPtr and a new WeakPtrFactory

data member. For added safety, these classes are marked final when

possible.



In some cases, implementation classes already had a WeakPtrFactory

data member, so this fixes the inconsistency of WeakPtr instances

being generated by the SupportsWeakPtr base class and the data

member.



Bug: 647430

Change-Id: Ic42351ec8496a080c79f0a951710116551f590b3

> [sync/android] Share explicit passphrase with platform when it's entered

> Add infrastructure to pass the explicit passphrase to layers outside

entry.title: Implement new schema and time based removal into CdmStorageDatabase
entry.content:
A new schema is introduced into CdmStorageDatabase to add last_modified

and file_size to be able to support time-based deletion and time-based

usage calculation.



Methods were implemented to delete by time frame, by storage key, and

to calculate file size using SQL queries for time frames by storing

the file size into the CdmStorageDatabase to be a one time operation.



This CL also provides the functionality that automatically deletes the

database if a Delete function for a subset (i.e file, storage key,

time-frame) ends up removing entries such that there are no more entries

in the database.



An SQL statement is used to alter the version1 database so that we don't

run into crashes when a user that already has the CdmStorageDatabase

v1.0 in their profile runs into queries that are made for the v2.0, such

as writing into the column file_size, since file_size is only in v2.0.



Testing: unittests +



Manual Testing Steps for the Schema Alter code:

1. Build chrome on main branch.

2. Go to chrome://flags and enable kCdmStorageDatabase and

kCdmStorageDatabaseMigration.

3. Open a new profile, name it CdmStorageDatabase (or anything you want)

4. Play this website: https://integration.staging.widevine.com/player?contentUrl=https://storage.googleapis.com/wvtemp/hmchen/poc/tears_hd_cenc.mpd&proxyServerUrl=https://proxy.uat.widevine.com/proxy?video_id=GTS_CAN_PLAY_CLIENT_TOKEN%26provider=widevine_test%26full_response=true&persistentStateRequired=true

5. Log the kVersionNumber (should be 1) (I did this through LOG(ERROR)).

6. A value should be written.

7. Quit Chrome.

8. Switch your branch to these changes using git and build chrome.

9. Open chrome, verify the same flags are still enabled, and open

the same profile you used as before.

10. Play same website as step #4.

11. log the kVersionNumber (should be 2) (I did this through LOG(ERROR))

12. View in chrome://histograms/Media.EME that the

IncompatibleDatabaseDetected histogram was triggered.

13. Verify that playback plays continuously and Chrome does not crash.



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAMS= Media.EME.CdmStorageManager.DeleteDatabaseError.Incognito, Media.EME.CdmStorageManager.DeleteDatabaseError.NonIncognito.



Bug: 1454512

Change-Id: I64f9dff580114545ececf5d7b4f03124b1f55192

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4994868

Reviewed-by: Evan Stade

Reviewed-by: Evan Liu

Reviewed-by: John Rummell

Commit-Queue: Vikram Pasupathy

entry.title: firmware_update: Add metric to track request duration of failed installs
entry.content:
This CL adds a new metric type called `ChromeOS.FirmwareUpdateUi.FailedRequestDuration

.RequestId{DeviceRequestId}`.



This metric records the duration and ID of a request if there was one

active at the time of an install failure. This metric can be used to

understand timeout durations and which kinds of requests are failing.

entry.title: Change the calendar default view to show more dates
entry.content:
This CL changed the calendar default view so that there are at least two

more rows under today's row. Here are some cases:

- If there are already at least two more rows under today's row, do

nothing.

- If there are less than two rows under today's row:

- If the calendar bubble is big enough, scroll up today's row so that

today's row is visible and there are two rows under today's row.

- If the calendar bubble is small, scroll to today's row.

- If the up next view exists:

- If the calendar bubble is big enough, scroll up today's row so that

today's row is visible and there are two rows under today's row

that is not hidden by the up next view.

- If the calendar bubble is small or today's date is hidden by the up

next view, scroll to today's row.



Screenshot:

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/9kM86nKhCoyNmCW



Bug: b:306483442

entry.content:
Expose the feature flags to enable the holding space wallpaper nudge:

- HoldingSpaceWallpaperNudge

- HoldingSpaceWallpaperNudgeForceEligibility



HoldingSpaceWallpaperNudgeForceEligibility is a rename from

HoldingSpaceWallpaperNudgeIgnoreRateLimiting, also done in this CL so

that it can also be used to control whether account type and user

new-ness affects whether the nudge is shown, in addition to rate

limiting. That additional control will be added in an upcoming CL.

entry.title: Add test to protect against Holding Space UI regression.
entry.content:
Holding Space used to own the constant which determines its bubble's

width but now shares a constant with the rest of the system UI bubbles:



https://crrev.com/c/chromium/src/+/4562798



Holding Space UI is not yet implemented to be fully reactive to

variable bubble widths, so this CL adds a test to serve as a speed

bump to (hopefully) prevent the shared constant from being updated and

inadvertently breaking Holding Space UI.



Change-Id: I9910a6fe8894277f20dc56131e519c76f9a39d9c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5166848

Commit-Queue: David Black

Reviewed-by: Angus McLean

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1242690}

entry.title: [Code Health] Remove some uses of base::SupportsWeakPtr. (12)
entry.content:
This CL removes base::SupportsWeakPtr as a base class of by doing

the following:



1. ContextualSearchContext now has a virtual member function that

returns a base::WeakPtr. It has a new

base::WeakPtrFactory data member for generating base::WeakPtr

instances.



2. Classes that derives from ContextualSearchContext have a new

base::WeakPtrFactory data member and override the function to

return a WeakPtr their own factories. For added safety, these

classes are marked final.



Bug: 647430

Change-Id: Ibd74d74a38aa77820adf7a10bfa4e12bc56915c6

entry.title: Crash Fix for removing layer on shutdown
entry.content:
The ripple_layer_ is removed during shutdown, but the layers parent

is already unlinked, resulting in a UAF.



The views::View dtor first recursively unlinks all parent layers via

a call to views::View::OrphanLayers, then it deletes the view. This

means that the assumption that layer()->parent() exists in



in the TrayBackgroundView Dtor if the view is in the process of being

removed via a call to views::View::RemoveAllChildViews().



TrayBackgroundView: :RemoveRippleLayer() is not valid when it is called

Bug: b:317118003

Change-Id: I5459989ac778fe927e8e287b5151ae25300c5143

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5166508

entry.content:
This moves the contents of

`SplitViewController::OnWindowBoundsChanged()` to

`SplitViewDivider::OnWindowBoundsChanged()`, since the functionality

is only needed when the divider is alive and we are resizing via it.



This subsequently removes the `CHECK_EQ(root_window_, window

->GetRootWindow());` line since this can be called during animation.

entry.title: Remove getLastUsedRegularProfile from BookmarkPage.
entry.content:
Instead of passing Profile and isIncognito, just pass the Profile instance.



Previously, the original Profile was always passed into the Bookmark code, which resulted in the same experience regardless of Incognito or normal mode. For BookmarkModel and ShoppingService, they both redirect to the original Profile, which is safe to use the incognito or normal one. For the SyncService and IdentityManager, it will return null for incognito, so this requires changes the original profile to not break those usecases.

C++ and XML to address follow-up comments from crrev.com/c/5141628:



1. Record more forked conditions when resizing groups in a batch.

2. Change timeout enum histogram to count style to get specific time

records for round total update time.

3. Adjust the single interest group update time histogram position.



Add one more metric:

Record the total count of interest groups per update round.



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[Ads.InterestGroup.GroupUpdate.RoundResult]=Replaced by Ads.InterestGroup.Auction.GroupUpdate.RoundTime

OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[Ads.InterestGroup.Auction.GroupUpdate.Duration]=Replaced by Ads.InterestGroup.Net.DownloadTime.Update

entry.title: [ChromeVox] Fix ChromeVox crash when earcon logging enabled, fix log page
entry.content:
ChromeVox crashed on startup with earcon logging

enabled because the earcons.js tries to write to the

log but the log store wasn't yet initialized. Fixes

the issue by moving log store initialization earlier.



Fixes log page which was trying to load log_page.js

instead of log.js and had a file not found error.



Note: In the hopes of getting the bug fixed ASAP,

this change does not convert all touched JS files

to typescript, as most edits were negligible.



Bug: b/318518541,b/318531241

AX-Relnotes: Fixes log page functionality and crash on startup with earcon logging enabled

entry.content:
Update DriveRecentFileSuggestionProvider to search for recently viewed

files in addition to recently modified files. The provider now issues

two local searches (recently modified, and recently viewed), then

deduplicates and sorts received result lists before returning them

to its clients.

entry.title: Update PresentationFeedback timestamps on Mac
entry.content:
- feedback.timestamp: It was the time of rendering completion.

Now it's the display_time from CVDisplayLinkCallback.

- feedback.ready_timestamp: It was zero.

Now it's the time when rendering has completed.

- feedback.latch_timestamp: It was zero.

Now it's the time when CATransaction Commits and CoreAnimation

latches the frame.

entry.title: Revert "[DevTools] Take shadow roots into account for duplicate ID issue"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 442adb397a265ff3b09c3450a6f52dd5e66d1b5c.



Reason for revert: This looks related to an ongoing test failure:

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20CFI/26762/test-results?sortby=&groupby=



ComputeBaseComputedStyleDiff(applied_style, *correct_style) ( vs. "Field diff: outline_color_(was \"rgb(229, 151, 0)\", should be \"rgb(16, 16, 16)\") ")



While I didn't see a direct correlation, it is in the same area, and if we looked at shadow dom we might get a different result than looking without shadow dom.



Original change's description:

> [DevTools] Take shadow roots into account for duplicate ID issue

>

> Fixed: 1493155

> Change-Id: I9294ca0622ec05698be52b6f0cc788e74c99b803

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5158427

> Commit-Queue: Wolfgang Beyer

> Reviewed-by: Bruno Braga

> Reviewed-by: Florian Leimgruber

> Code-Coverage: findit-for-me@appspot.gserviceaccount.com

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1242385}

entry.title: Android: Use per-target cache directories for non-default Lint runs
entry.content:
Lint wipes the cache when its version changes, so sharing a cache

between two versions of lint will have it constantly being wiped.



I don't think this was actively causing issues, but noticed it when

debugging other lint things.

entry.title: customization: Refresh Key Display and DomKey before sending event
entry.content:
For the purposes of Shortcut and Peripheral customization, the VKEY that

is stored by the system will be the VKEY remapped as though it was in

the US english keyboard layout.



Adds four additional accelerators that get remapped based on location.

This includes:

* Semicolon

* Apostrophe

* Backtick

* International Backslash (key to the left of Z on ISO layouts)



These keys will only get remapped based on location if the original VKEY

is not an alphanumeric VKEY. This prevents situations where the VKEY

semantic meaning will be clobbered due to the positional remapping.



Since the keys will only be positionally remapped sometimes, the

shortcuts app must hide cases of shortcuts which are not possible to be

produced in the current layout. This can only happen if the key in the

current layout will NOT be positionally remapped, but in the US layout

it would be remapped.



Bug: b/241965717

entry.title: media/gpu/v4l2: Allow V4L2DevicePoller blocking behaviour
entry.content:
V4L2DevicePoller has two problem re. threading:

- One is that it calls Stop() on an internal thread [1], which

violates AssertBaseSyncPrimitivesAllowed()[2] (because Stop() is

blocking).

- Another is that the member thread uses Wait() [3] and Poll() [4]

(both of which are blocking) on that internal Thread that is constructed as non blockable (and this can't be tweaked BTW).



Fixing V4L2DevicePoller would be risky and complicated, and it's

anyway going to be deprecated (I estimate in the next 6 months or

so). This CL explicitly allows for the blocking behaviour.



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/gpu/v4l2/v4l2_device_poller.cc;l=85;drc=d70f89acd09b75f61ae0d18689737246eca6c499

[2] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:base/threading/thread_restrictions.cc;l=160-170;drc=9a4c11173d5209a3b813c746e342155896738eb3

[3] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/gpu/v4l2/v4l2_device_poller.cc;l=120;drc=d70f89acd09b75f61ae0d18689737246eca6c499



Bug: b:314147674, 1513721

entry.title: Replace SuggestionContext::is_filling_credit_card by a FillingProduct
entry.content:
This boolean was used with if-else statements to branch between address

and credit card suggestions.



Now that we have more data types to suggest (e.g. IBAN) and that

there is plans to add support for more data types, it becomes

problematic and leads to confusion and bugs (see the attached bug).



This CL replaces the boolean by a FillingProduct member and the if-else

statements by explicit if conditions.



This CL touches the following metric:

Autofill.AddressSuggestionsCount

It fixes cases where this metric was logged for non-address suggestions.



Fixed: b/318488182
